casebody.data:
NATIONAL BOULEVARD BANK OF CHICAGO, Plaintiff-Appellee, v. Meyer SCHWARTZ, Defendant-Appellant. No. 177, Docket 25856. United States Court of Appeals Second Circuit. Argued Feb. 3 and 4, 1960. Decided Feb. 26, 1960. Kenneth S. Oltarsh, New York City (Virginia C. Duncombe and Duncombe, Oltarsh & Schott, New York City, or the brief), for plaintiff-appellee. Hyman Fried, New York City (Abbie Goldstein and Fried, Beck, Tannenbaum & Field, New York City, N. Y., and Edward R. Schwartz of the Bar of District of Columbia, on the brief), for defendant-appellant.

*824Before MEDINA and WATERMAN, Circuit Judges, and MADDEN, Judge, United States Court of Claims.*

Sitting by designation.

 PER CURIAM.

The judgment is affirmed on the opinion of Judge Dawson, 175 F.Supp. 74.
